author: tlindsay42
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
PS C:\> foreach ( $cmdletName in ( ( Get-Command ).Where( { $_.Source -match '^Microsoft\.PowerShell\.' } ).Name ) ) { ( Get-Help -Nam
e $cmdletName -Full | Out-String -Stream ) -cmatch 'COMPONENT|FUNCTIONALITY|ROLE' }
PS C:\>
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
The built-in commands should have content populated in the Component, Role, & Functionality sections.

Actual behavior
---------------
No built-in commands utilize these help sections.

```powershell
PS C:\> foreach ( $cmdletName in ( ( Get-Command ).Where( { $_.Source -match '^Microsoft\.PowerShell\.' } ).Name ) ) { ( Get-Help -Nam
e $cmdletName -Full | Out-String -Stream ) -cmatch 'COMPONENT|FUNCTIONALITY|ROLE' }
PS C:\>
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Reference: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7107
title: No built-in cmdlets have the Component, Role, or Functionality sections filled in
